trait.name: Circuitry
entries: The construct has disadvantage on saving throws against effects that would deal ion or lightning damage.

trait.name: Heavy Durasteel Armor
entries: The outer layer of the AT-AT is covered in heavy armor, making it difficult for smaller arms to damage it. Unless the damage from a single attack or effect exceeds 30 points, the AT-AT takes no damage from that attack. If the AT-AT takes an amount of damage from a single attack or effect equal to or greater than its damage threshold, it takes damage as normal.

trait.name: Piloted
entries: The construct requires an active pilot to take any actions, and if the pilot is subjected to any conditions that the construct is not immune to, the construct is also subjected to those conditions. The pilot may take their own action or one of the actions granted by the construct.

trait.name: Towering
entries: Creatures of Large size or smaller can stand in the AT-AT's space.

trait.name: Troop Transport
entries: The AT-AT can transport a maximum of 40 stormtroopers and five speeder bikes, which it can deploy using its Deploy Troops legendary action, or which can be fought by creatures inside of the AT-AT.

trait.name: Vulnerable Interior
entries: The AT-AT's interior is vulnerable to damage done by grenades, mines and charges, unless it is immune to that damage. It also automatically fails all Dexterity saving throws from such effects that occur in its interior.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The AT-AT can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its laser cannon volley and two with its medium repeaters.

action.name: Laser Cannon Volley
entries: The AT-AT chooses a point within 320 ft and lets loose a blast from each of its heavy laser cannons that explodes in a 15ft cube around that point. Each creature within the cube must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 54 ({@damage 12d8}) energy damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Medium Repeaters
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 240/360 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d10}) energy damage.

action.name: Stomp
entries: All creatures standing within the AT-AT's space or within 5ft of it must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 78 ({@damage 12d12}) kinetic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the AT-AT's choice within 240 feet of the AT-AT and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition Frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the AT-AT's Frightful Presence for 24 hours.

legendary.name: Stomp
entries: The AT-AT makes a stomp attack.

legendary.name: Repeating Blasters
entries: The AT-AT makes a single attack with its medium repeaters.

legendary.name: Deploy Troops (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The AT-AT mobilizes some of the soldiers traveling within it. It deploys {@dice 1d4 + 2} Troopers and 1 74-Z speeder bike. These troops appear in any unoccupied spaces within 10 feet of the AT-AT.

trait.name: Techcasting
entries: The droid is a 5th-level techcaster. Its techcasting ability is Intelligence (tech save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with tech powers). It has 22 tech points and knows the following tech powers: At will: assess the situation, electroshock, venomous strike 1st-level: poison dart, spot the weakness, toxin scan, tranquilizer 2nd-level: paralyze humanoid, toxin purge, truth serum 3rd-level: tactical advantage

action.name: Tortuous Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) kinetic damage and, if the target is a creature, the creature is shocked until the end of its next turn.

If a thrown target collides with immovable object, such as a wall or floor, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) kinetic damage for every 10 feet it was thrown before impact. If the target would collide with another creature instead, that other creature must succeed on a DC19 Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Crushing Stride
entries: The droid tank moves up to its speed in a straight line. During this move, it can enter Large or smaller creatures' spaces. A creature whose space the droid tank enters must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw. On a successful save, the creature is pushed 5 feet to the nearest space out of the droid tank's path . On a failed save, the creature falls {@condition prone} and takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) kinetic damage. If the droid tank remains in the {@condition prone} creature's space, the creature is also {@condition restrained} until it's no longer in the same space as the droid tank. While {@condition restrained} in this way, the creature, or another creature within 5 feet of it, can make a {@dc 18} Strength check. On a success, the creature is shunted to an unoccupied space of its choice within 5 feet of the droid tank and is no longer {@condition restrained}.

A creature in the area of more than one sphere is affected only once. Large and larger constructs and structures have disadvantage on the saving throw, and suffer an additional 21 ({@dice 6d6}) fire and 21 ({@damage 6d6}) kinetic damage if they fail the save by 10 or more.

action.name: Will
entries: Abeloth turns her will upon one creature she can see within 120 feet. That target must make a {@dc 23} Wisdom saving throw. Unless the target is {@condition incapacitated}, it can avert it's attention to automatically succeed on the save. If the target does so, it can't see Abeloth until the start of its next turn. If the target again focuses on Abeloth in the meantime, it must immediately make the save. If the target fails the save, the target suffers one of the following effects of Abeloth's choice or at random: 1. Beguiling Will. The target is {@condition stunned} until the start of Abeloth's next turn. 2. Hypnotic Will. The target is {@condition charmed} by Abeloth until the start of Abeloth's next turn. Abeloth chooses how the {@condition charmed} target uses its actions, reactions, and movement. Because this effect requires Abeloth's strong effort, she can't use her Maddening Will legendary action until the start of her next turn. 3. Insane Will. The target suffers the effect of the confusion power without making a saving throw. The effect lasts until the start of Abeloth's next turn. Abeloth doesn't need to concentrate on the power.

trait.name: Amphibious

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The monster uses its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws. It can use its Swallow instead of its bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 2d10 + 10}) kinetic damage. If the target is a creature it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 20}). Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the monster can't bite another target.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d6 + 10}) kinetic damage.

action.name: Tail

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the monster's choice within 120 feet of the monster and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each turn, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effects ends for it, the creature is immune to the monster's Frightful Presence for 24 hours.

action.name: Water Torrent {@recharge 5}
entries: the monster exhales a torrent of water in a 120 foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw, taking 42 ({@damage 12d6}) kinetic damage and 42 ({@damage 12d6}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The monster makes one bite attack against a Large or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target takes the bite's damage, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the monster, and it takes 42 ({@damage 12d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the monster's turns. If the monster takes 50 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the monster must succeed on a {@dc 25} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the monster. If the monster dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 30 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The monster makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The monster makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Whirlpool (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: A creature must make a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw the first time on a turn that it enters the whirlpool or that the whirlpool enters its space, including when the whirlpool first appears. A creature takes {@damage 6d8} kinetic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. In addition, a Large or smaller creature that fails the save must succeed on a {@dc 21} Strength saving throw or become {@condition restrained} in the whirlpool until the power ends. When a creature starts its turn {@condition restrained} by the whirlpool, the creature is pulled 5 feet deeper inside it, unless the creature is at the bottom. A {@condition restrained} creature moves with the whirlpool and is submerged when the effect ends, unless the creature has some means to stay afloat. A {@condition restrained} creature can use an action to make a {@dc 21} Strength or Dexterity check. If successful, the creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by the whirlpool and is hurled {@dice 3d6 x 10} feet away from it in a random direction. The whirlpool ends at the beginning of the monster's turn unless the monster used the Whirlpool legendary action to maintain the whirlpool. The monster creates a whirlpool in the water at a point within 30 feet that it can see. The whirlwind is a 10-foot-radius, 30-foot-deep cylinder centered on that point. On subsequent turns, the monster can use the Whirlpool legendary action to maintain and move the whirlpool up to 30 feet in any direction along the surface of the water. The whirlpool sucks up any medium or smaller objects that aren't secured to anything and that aren't worn or carried by anyone.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/day)
entries: If the Sarlacc fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Gargantuan Strength

trait.name: Burried
entries: The sarlacc is resistant to damage from sources beyond 60 feet and immune to damage from sources beyond 120 feet.

trait.name: Grasping Tentacles
entries: The sarlacc can have up to eight tentacles at a time. Each tentacle can be attacked (AC 18; 40 hit points; immunity to psychic damage). A tentacle can also be broken if a creature takes an action and succeeds on a {@dc 22} Strength check against it. Destroying a tentacle in either way deals no damage to the sarlacc, which can extrude a replacement tentacle on its next turn, but it causes the sarlacc to spend a legendary action for no effect. If the sarlacc has no legendary actions remaining this turn to spend, the sarlacc regains one fewer spent legendary actions at the start of its next turn than it would otherwise regain. The sarlacc can be forced to spend no more than two legendary actions in this way.

action.name: Multiattack

action.name: Bite

action.name: Swallow
entries: The sarlacc makes one bite attack against a Large or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target takes the bite's damage, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the sarlacc, and it takes 35 ({@damage 10d6}) psychic damage at the start of each of the sarlacc's turns. A creature reduced to zero hit points this way stops taking the psychic damage and becomes stable. If the sarlacc dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 10 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Pheromones {@recharge 5}
entries: The sarlacc releases pheromones in a 300 foot radius. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save the creature is {@condition charmed} by the sarlacc for 1 minute. While {@condition charmed} this way, the target tries to get as close to the sarlacc as possible, using its actions to Dash until it is within 5 feet of the sarlacc. A {@condition charmed} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns and whenever it takes damage, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature has advantage on saving throws against the sarlacc's Pheromones for 24 hours.

legendary.name: Earth-Shaking Movement
